text.section:
A party may perform its contractual duties or exercise its contractual rights through a delegate or a subcontract unless:
The contract prohibits delegation or subcontracting; or
The other party has a substantial interest in having the original promisor perform or control the performance.
Delegating or subcontracting performance does not relieve the delegating party of a duty to perform or of liability for breach.
An attempted delegation that violates a term prohibiting delegation is not effective.
